translation.en: [woman 1 in Norwegian] I know it's Christmas,
but you don't get into the holiday spirit when it's sunny.
translation.ko: 따뜻하고 해 쨍쨍하면 분위기가 안 나는걸요

translation.en: -I need to get home to Norway. -[woman 2 on phone] Yeah.
-I'm so excited. -[woman 2] There's so much to do.
translation.ko: - 너무 신나요 - 할 일이 정말 많아

translation.en: -It's okay, Mom. You've got time. -[mom] Yes, but still…
translation.ko: - 시간 많으니까 괜찮아요, 엄마 - 그건 그렇지만…

translation.en: Has it been snowing a lot? [mom] Sure, but tell me about your boyfriend!
translation.ko: - 눈 많이 왔어요? - 그럼! 근데 남친 얘기 좀 해봐

translation.en: Well, you can meet him if you come to visit us.
translation.ko: 여기 놀러 오면 만날 수 있잖아요

translation.en: We're settling in nicely. We're doing very well.
translation.ko: 이사도 잘했고 아주 잘 지내고 있어요

translation.en: Herregud? [in English] Is that a good thing?
I know you love Christmas, so I wanted to do something Christmas-themed for the…
translation.ko: 자기는 크리스마스 좋아하니까 그런 분위기로 준비해 봤어, 우리…

translation.en: And I know this might be early for Norwegian standards,
translation.ko: 노르웨이인 기준으로는 좀 이른 감이 있겠지만

translation.en: but, in India, we would have had two kids already and they would be in college.
translation.ko: 인도인들은 이때쯤 이미 대학생 자녀가 둘이나 있거든

translation.en: So, if you're not, like, doing anything for the next couple of decades…
translation.ko: 그러니까 앞으로 20년쯤 별달리 할 일이 없다면…

translation.en: You don't even know my middle name. [laughs]
And did you actually also know
that I have diabetes running in my family and that's…
You haven't even met my family yet.
But when you know, you know.
Look, the rules say you have to say yes or no.
translation.ko: 승낙이든 거절이든 해야 하는 거 아냐?

translation.en: joining me and my family for Christmas in Norway this year?
translation.ko: 올 크리스마스에 우리 가족이 있는 노르웨이로 가는 거야

translation.en: [sighs] I would love to, but it's like you don't know my middle name.
translation.ko: 그러고 싶은데 자기가 내 중간 이름을 모르니까…

translation.en: -[man] Yes. Of course. I would love to. -Yeah?
Oh, you have so much to look forward to.
-Christmas in Norway is… is the best. -Mm-hmm.
You know, I'm so excited to meet your mom, Anne-Lise,
translation.ko: 자기 엄마 아네리세를 만날 생각에 신나

translation.en: and the rest of the family.
I'm gonna tell them to have a god jul.
-So my family doesn't really know that-- -Is it jool or jul?
-Uh, jul. Yeah, it's jul. Yeah. -Jul? Okay, jul.
Uh, my family doesn't really know…
[man in Norwegian] Ladies and gentlemen, we're landing at Oslo Airport.
translation.ko: 탑승객 여러분, 잠시 후 오슬로 공항에 착륙할 예정이오니

translation.en: Please fasten your seat belt and make sure the trays…
[in English] Sorry. What were you saying?
is super excited to see you.
You think this is fresh air? [laughs]
Are you gonna be like this the whole time?
It's just a family sweater tradition thing that we've been doing forever.
translation.ko: 가족끼리 같은 스웨터 입는 게 우리 가족의 오랜 전통이야

translation.en: I'm sure my mom has knitted one for you too.
Oh, I should have got them something.
Oh, like the Indian equivalent of a family sweater.
You know what I was trying to tell you earlier. Yeah.
-Um, I haven't-- -[driver] So, you're from India?
Uh, yeah, dude. Have you ever been?
No, I've never been to India. But I've been to Turkey.
translation.ko: 아뇨, 인도는 못 가봤어요 그래도 터키는 가봤죠
이런 걸 공기 좋다고 하는 거지

translation.en: I think my nostril hair froze to each other.
[Anne-Lise] So good to see you, Thea.
[in English] Hello, Josh, and welcome to Norway.
translation.ko: 어서 와요, 조시 노르웨이에 온 걸 환영해요

translation.en: -Yes, I can see that. Yes. -[Jashan laughs]
Oh, this is so nice to finally meet you, Shazam.
translation.ko: 드디어 만나게 되다니 정말 반가워요, 샤잠

translation.en: Oh, wow. Your home is beautiful.
-[Jashan in English] Oh, look at this. -Yes, yes.
Okay, now, this, this is Christmas.
Oh, sorry. It's, uh… It's, uh, Jashan.
-It's fine. You'll get it. -Yeah, but it was--
Yeah. So that's like this tradition that we had,
translation.ko: 그건 우리 집안의 전통 같은 거야

translation.en: making all these Christmas decorations every year.
And when did you make this? [laughs]
It's all wonky and messed up. It's so sweet.
My husband made this the last year before he died.
translation.ko: 남편이 만든 거예요 작년에 죽기 전에

translation.en: Yeah, he… he really loved Christmas.
Who's a good boy? Who's a-- -[Balder growls]
translation.ko: 이 귀여운 녀석은 누굴까? 이 귀…

translation.en: -[in Norwegian] What's up with Balder? -Well, sometimes he reacts to…
translation.ko: - 발레르 왜 이래요? - 그게, 얘가 가끔 그…

translation.en: [hesitatingly] To… people who are so unfamiliar.
[in Norwegian] It's very nice that you made some, but I think…
translation.ko: 준비해 줘서 고마워요, 엄마 근데 우린

translation.en: -We're tired and ate on the plane. -[Anne-Lise] Yeah.
I think we're gonna go to bed.
-[Thea] Yeah. I know. -Look at your earrings.
And this is just a year after.
-But this is like a different person. -Yeah, but it's a posh period.
translation.ko: - 꼭 다른 사람 같은데? - 완전 고상하던 시절이지

translation.en: Oh, and, uh, who's this dude?
[inhales, smacks lips] Uh, good night, mamma.
Sorry. Isn't that what you say in, uh, Norwegian? Mamma?
You… You don't have to call me that.
Oh, no. In India, your in-laws are like your parents.
So that's why I'm actually very happy to call you mamma.
translation.ko: 그래서 어머니라고 부르게 되어 얼마나 기쁜지 모릅니다

translation.en: Yes, but… but we are in… in Telemark.
Okay. Uh, what… what would you prefer that I called you?
But that's so, uh… It's so impersonal.
No? Well, then, mamma it is.
translation.ko: - 안 돼 - 안 되나요? 그럼 어머니로 결정 났네요

translation.en: Do you think, uh, she likes me?
do you think your mom likes me?
You didn't tell her I was Indian.
Yeah. So then, why not tell her?
translation.ko: 그럼 왜 엄마한테 말 안 했어?

translation.en: You know, my dad, he was like…
the one who would reason with her.
So if I told her, like, three weeks ago that we were engaged, she would…
translation.ko: 3주 전에 약혼했단 얘기를 했으면 아마 엄마는…

translation.en: -Photoshop me in a family card? -[Thea scoffs]
She would sit alone in her room…
She would blow it totally out of proportion.
translation.ko: 온갖 걸 다 확대해석하고 계셨을 거야

translation.en: [female presenter] In India, we are often told that a daughter's place is with her in-laws.
this practice is just as common in Indian cities as in the villages.
translation.ko: 이런 관습은 시골뿐 아니라 도시에서도 흔합니다

translation.en: -I've put on some coffee if you want. -[cup thuds on table]
Have you talked to Jørgen since…
translation.ko: 그때 이후론 예르겐이랑 얘기 안 해봤니?

translation.en: [whispers] I know that it hasn't been easy for him either.
No, I'm sure it hasn't, but it was a long time ago, Mom.
translation.ko: 글쎄요, 그럴 수도 있지만 벌써 오래전 일이에요

translation.en: No, it's just a shame that it had to end like that.
translation.ko: 글쎄, 엄마는 그렇게 끝난 게 좀 안타깝더라

translation.en: All that stuff just got too complicated.
Dad and I always thought it was going to be the two of you.
translation.ko: 엄마 아빠는 너희 둘이 꼭 잘될 줄 알았다는 거

translation.en: I'm going to get started on the rice pudding now
Dad always used to make it two days in advance.
You could have told me a little earlier
Is that okay to say, though? "Indian"? Is that allowed?
translation.ko: 그렇게 말해도 되는 건가? 인도인이라고 말해도 돼?

translation.en: Yes, Mom. You can say Indian.
[Anne-Lise] Fine. But do I have to make two Christmas dinners now?
translation.ko: - 네, 인도인이라고 해도 돼요 - 그래 근데 이제 성탄절 만찬을 두 가지로 만들어야 할까?

translation.en: I know that Norwegian and Indian cultures are incredibly different.
translation.ko: 노르웨이 문화와 인도 문화는 완전히 다르잖니

translation.en: -What have you been googling now? -[Anne-Lise] I haven't been googling.
There's just so much to do before Christmas.
translation.ko: 크리스마스 전에 할 일이 너무 많아

translation.en: I have to prepare the medister meatballs, and then we have to get firewood.
translation.ko: 성탄 미트볼 만들고 장작 구하러 가야 해

translation.en: Your brother gets stressed out if we don't have firewood.
translation.ko: 장작 없다고 하면 네 오빠가 엄청 스트레스받잖니

translation.en: And now I might have to make two Christmas dinners.
translation.ko: 근데 이제 성탄절 만찬까지 두 가지로 만들어야 하다니

translation.en: I don't know your boyfriend, and I don't know what they eat in India for Christmas.
translation.ko: 난 네 남자 친구도 잘 모르고 인도에서 성탄절에 뭘 먹는지도 잘 몰라

translation.en: Yeah, the sun doesn't rise until ten.
Maybe we should give my mom a… a bit more time.
translation.ko: 엄마한테 시간을 좀 더 줘야 할 거 같아

translation.en: You don't wanna tell her about the engagement?
No. Yeah. Of course I want to tell her. It's just--
Do I need to ask for her permission or something?
translation.ko: 어머니께 허락 같은 거 받아야 하나?

translation.en: No. No, no, no. That's not a thing here.
[Jashan] Okay, well, then we should just tell her.
No need to keep it a secret, right?
I just want the timing to be right.
When will the timing be right?
I just want her to get to know you.
translation.ko: 엄마가 자기를 잘 알게 되면 좋겠어

translation.en: see the side of you that I fell in love with.
translation.ko: 내가 사랑에 빠진 이유를 알려드리고 싶어

translation.en: -You want me to have sex with your mom? -[Thea laughs]
Fine. I just wasn't ready for this, but, you know, if that's local tradition…
translation.ko: 난 아직 준비가 안 됐지만 그게 이곳의 전통이라면야…

translation.en: And then we can tell her.
It's going to be a perfect Christmas.
[Jashan] Hey, I know you told me to be myself,
but is there anything more I can do to connect with your brother?
translation.ko: 자기 오빠랑 친해질 만한 뭔가가 없을까?

translation.en: Like what does he like? Sports? Snow?
You're gonna be fine. He's gonna like you.
translation.ko: 자긴 잘할 거야 오빠도 자길 좋아할 테고

translation.en: And his wife is the fun one, right?
More… More like no during Christmas.
[Thea] No. Because she's on edge with my mom.
-Yeah. It's gonna be fine. -[Jashan] It's gonna be fine.
[Thea] Merry Christmas! And look at you!
-Nice to meet you. -[Simen] Nice to meet you.
This must be Ronja. God jul, Ronja.
[in English] Having some trouble with the chair?
-[Jashan] Stuck? Okay. Can I try? -Stuck, yeah. Sure.
-I have a black belt in car seats. -Okay.
translation.ko: 사실 제가 카시트 종목 검정띠거든요 그래요

translation.en: [in Norwegian] Am I a horrible human being if I say that I'm a little surprised?
translation.ko: 조금 놀랐다고 하면 나 나쁜 인간인가?

translation.en: There are a billion Indians, so the odds of meeting one are pretty big.
translation.ko: 인도인이 10억 명은 되는데 만날 기회가 얼마나 많겠어?

translation.en: -I wasn't supposed to tell you yet. -What?
Are you kidding? You just met.
translation.ko: 장난해? 만난 지 얼마 안 됐잖아

translation.en: I'm waiting for the perfect timing.
This is going to be great!
-[Jashan in English] And we're good. -[Ronja] Møkkastol.
[in English] You have to taste this.
[Thea] Brown cheese on Christmas cake is the best.
translation.ko: 크리스마스 케이크에 브라운치즈를 올려 먹는 게 최고지

translation.en: [Jashan whispering] Sorry, mamma. I think I might be allergic to snow.
translation.ko: 죄송해요, 어머니 제가 눈 알레르기인가 봐요

translation.en: [Jashan in English] Okay. Ready? Three, two, one.
♪ All is calm, all is bright… ♪
[in English] You hang Norwegian flags on Christmas?
[in Norwegian] Don't eat the decorations, Hildegunn.
-Is it decorations? -It is decorations. [in English] I didn't know.
[in Norwegian] Help me in the kitchen, will you? Yes, of course.
translation.ko: - 주방 일 좀 도와줄래? - 네, 그럼요

translation.en: Simen, we are not supposed to eat these.
[In English] You know, even Americans don't do this. They're pretty patriotic.
translation.ko: 애국심 투철한 미국인들도 이렇게는 안 해

translation.en: -That's a thing? -It's a thing in Norway.
What if we make dinner something special tonight? and tell them about the engagement?
translation.ko: 저녁에 특별 만찬 만들면서 약혼 얘기 꺼내면 어떨까?

translation.en: [whispering in English] Does she understand English? I don't… I don't know.
-[whispers in Norwegian] What did he say? -[chuckles]
You and your family have been sharing your culture with me,
and I thought I would share the best of Indian culture with you. Food.
translation.ko: 난 인도 문화 중에 최고를 알려주려고 바로! 음식이지!

translation.en: Wow. Where did you get all the spices?
I bring them with me, bro. Duh.
You said let's make dinner something special.
Jashan, I said let's make dinner something special,
translation.ko: 자샨, 난 특별한 만찬을 만들자고 했지

translation.en: like… Not make something special for dinner.
translation.ko: 만찬을 위해 특별한 음식을 만들자는 게 아니라

translation.en: [sighs] I thought everyone would be busy with Christmas stuff,
and I would make dinner and surprise everyone.
It's, um… It's Teeny Tiny Christmas.
It's the day before the day before the big day,
and it's sort of like a big deal in our family.
I thought the big day was December 25th.
I told you. In Norway, it's 24th.
So there's a teeny day before a tiny day before the big day,
translation.ko: 그러니까, 올망 데이 다음에 졸망 데이 다음에 빅데이인데

translation.en: No. Maybe I exaggerated a little.
translation.ko: 아뇨, 그냥 좀 좋게 말한 거죠

translation.en: -What are you doing? -I don't know what I'm doing.
the dinner we're used to for Teeny Tiny Christmas.
translation.ko: 올망졸망 크리스마스 때 항상 먹던 건 아니긴 한데

translation.en: [in English] We always have medister cakes on Little Little Christmas.
translation.ko: 크리스마스 전전전날에는 항상 성탄 미트볼을 먹죠

translation.en: [exhales sharply] I actually just found out about Teeny Tiny Christmas.
translation.ko: 올망졸망 크리스마스 얘기는 방금 전에 들어서요

translation.en: -Yeah. But now we have curry, so… -[chuckles]
[in Norwegian] It was a tradition, though.
meatballs on Teeny Tiny Christmas, and you all really liked it.
translation.ko: 항상 성탄 미트볼을 만들었고 너희도 다 좋아했잖니

translation.en: But maybe we can just give this a try?
translation.ko: 그래도 그냥 한번 먹어보면 안 돼요?

translation.en: Did you hear that? Did you hear that?
-It was just Dad turning in his grave. -[Hildegunn] Stop it.
translation.ko: 아빠가 무덤에서 벌떡 일어나는 소리 뭐야, 그러지 마

translation.en: Ronja, Dad is joking. Grandpa is dead.
translation.ko: 로니아, 아빠 농담하는 거야 할아버지 안 살아나셨어

translation.en: [chuckling] He hasn't risen from the dead. He is not moving at all.
translation.ko: 부활하실 리가 없죠 무덤에서 꼼짝도 안 하세요

translation.en: [breathes shakily] May God be with him.
Thank you for keeping an open mind.
We've been eating meatballs every year.
[in English] Norwegians are a very accepting people.
I understand this is different from your normal traditions.
translation.ko: 노르웨이의 일반 전통과는 다르다는 거 알고 있습니다

translation.en: You've probably never had Indian food before. So--
translation.ko: 어쩌면 인도 음식도 안 드셔 보셨을 수도 있고

translation.en: [Simen and Hildegunn in Norwegian] Yes, yes.
[in English] Yeah. Maybe you can take it in English so that Jashan understands.
-We eat Indian food. -Yeah. We love Indian food.
translation.ko: - 우리 인도 요리 잘 먹어요 - 네, 아주 좋아해요

translation.en: There's great Indian food at the Chinese restaurant in town.
translation.ko: 시내에 있는 중국집에서 아주 맛있는 인도 요리를 팔죠

translation.en: I'm sorry, did you say there was a Chinese restaurant that serves Indian food?
-Yeah. It's not really Indian food. It's… -[Simen] Yeah.
translation.ko: 사실 그게 진짜 인도 요리는 아니고…

translation.en: [Simen] Yes. It's, uh… It's Indian and… and Chinese,
and… and they have a lot of Norwegian dishes.

translation.ko: - 노르웨이 요리도 많이 팔지? - 그렇지 피자나 햄버거 같은

translation.en: -And the chef… Oh! -Oh, the chef is so good.
[in Norwegian] Ronja, don't you agree? They serve good food at the Chinese place.
translation.ko: 그렇지, 로니아? 그 중국집 요리 진짜 잘하지?

translation.en: -[in English] Jashan is a good cook too. -[both chuckle]
-Mmm. Yes. -[Simen in Norwegian] It does smell.
-[in English] So please dig in. -[Hildegunn munching]
[in English] It's almost like a taco.
Shazam, since this is your, hmm, first Christmas--
Oh, we have Christmas in India.
[chuckles] Sorry. How do you usually celebrate?
translation.ko: 미안해요 그럼 크리스마스 때 뭐 해요?

translation.en: Well, uh, my family is not Christian,
translation.ko: 저희 가족은 기독교가 아니어서 그냥 이러고 놀아요

translation.en: so we do this funny thing of, like, we'll do a countdown to midnight,
translation.ko: 저희 가족은 기독교가 아니어서 그냥 이러고 놀아요 자정까지 카운트다운을 하고

translation.en: and then we say Merry Christmas,
and we get smashed and we have a lot of food, set off fireworks.
That sounds like New Year's here in Norway.
[Simen in Norwegian] "Sounds like"? It literally is. [Hildegunn in English] Yeah.
And, you know, this year, I'm so happy to be here with all of you
translation.ko: 올해는 여러분과 함께 지내게 돼서 정말 좋아요

translation.en: and to get to share this part of my culture with you.
What is it? Are you okay?
-[in English] Is it that spicy? -No, it's really…
[coughing] I'm so sorry. It's very good. I just have to…
-[in Norwegian] I'll go with Mom. -If you have to spit it out, use this.
translation.ko: - 나도 따라갈게 - 뱉을 거면 여기 뱉어

translation.en: Anne-Lise doesn't want it on her rug.
[in English] Yeah, just… Yeah, just… I just need to check.
[in Norwegian] You guys are being very dramatic.
-[in English] Mamma, water will not help. -[Anne-Lise] Excuse me?
translation.ko: - 어머니, 물은 도움 안 돼요 - 네?

translation.en: It's… You need some dairy. Uh, if you have yogurt?
I don't know. I don't know. I really don't know.

translation.ko: - 내놔 - 안 돼! - 와서 드세요 - 안 된다니까!

translation.en: -Don't take the pudding. We need it for-- -Mom, come on! We don't have a choice.
translation.ko: - 이리 와 - 푸딩은 안 돼 - 엄마, 어쩔 수 없어요 - 하지만 이건…

translation.en: But Dad said it needs to stay…
-[Simen in Norwegian] Oh, it burns. -Just go.
I think it needs more time to set.
translation.ko: 맞네요, 더 재워둬야 할 거 같아요

translation.en: [in English] How many chilies did you use?
Spice is about more than just chilies. This is super mild.
translation.ko: 매운맛은 고추로만 내는 게 아냐 이거 엄청 순한 맛인데

translation.en: There's a difference between Norwegian spicy and Indian spicy.
translation.ko: 노르웨이 매운맛이랑 인도 매운맛은 차이가 있죠

translation.en: [in Norwegian] I don't know if Simen told you,
but I lived in India for a couple of months after high school.
translation.ko: 나 중학교 때 인도에서 두어 달 살았어요

translation.en: [in English] Okay. Hildegunn, she… she… she… lived in India for several months.
-Oh! Oh, cool. That is cool. -[Hildegunn chuckles]
I actually… [chuckles] I wanted to show you this.
What is it? Don't you like it?
[in Norwegian] It doesn't matter what it means, does it?
Thea, it is important because it's a tattoo.
It's cut into my body until I die.
translation.ko: 죽을 때까지 내 몸에 새겨져 있는 거라고요

translation.en: I want to know what it says.
[in English] Hypothetically speaking, it might say gori.
That doesn't sound so bad. [chuckles] What… What does that mean?
translation.ko: 나쁜 말 같지는 않은데요 무슨 뜻이에요?

translation.en: White girl, that's… [inhales shakily] …exactly what I am.
I'm just gonna go help the others. Yeah.
I think your "poopadoonk" was a little bit dry, by the way.
translation.ko: 그나저나 이 '푸파덩크'는 좀 퍽퍽한 거 같아요

translation.en: Maybe tomorrow we can try to do Christmas the Norwegian way?
translation.ko: 내일은 크리스마스를 노르웨이식으로 해보는 거 어때?

translation.en: [Anne-Lise] "Out on a hike, what's not to like?"
[Simen] Out on a hike, what's not to…
[Jashan in English] Wow. How's she doing that?
In Norway we say that Norwegians are born with skis on their feet.
translation.ko: 노르웨이인은 태어날 때부터 발에 스키가 달렸다고들 해

translation.en: Yeah? Sounds like a painful childbirth.
No. [in Norwegian] Out on a hike, what's not to like?
translation.ko: 아니, 하이킹에 나섰는데 싫을 게 뭐가 있겠어?

translation.en: -Okay. Come on. I can help you. -[Jashan panting]
We have this lunch place just on the other side of the hill.
translation.ko: 저 언덕 너머에 점심 먹는 데가 있거든
- 맘에 들어? - 응, 점심 먹는 데라…

translation.en: [in Norwegian] Come on! Go, go, go!
[Jashan in English] Okay. So… So, what kind of food do they serve?
translation.ko: 좋아, 그런데 거기는 어떤 음식 나와?

translation.en: So this is what we would call koselig in Norway.
No. It's just that when you said there was a lunch place,
translation.ko: 아니야, 그냥… 아까 점심 먹는 데라고 했을 때

translation.en: you know, in my head, I thought there was gonna be…
translation.ko: 내 생각에는… 내 머릿속에 떠오른 건…

translation.en: Yeah. No, that would be crazy if there was a restaurant.
translation.ko: 그러게요 식당이라니 말도 안 되는데 말이죠

translation.en: [Anne-Lise] So, what do you guys think?
Maybe you should go in advance?
So we can ski at our tempo, so he doesn't feel…
translation.ko: 우리끼리 천천히 갈게요 그래야 이 사람이…
- 먼저 가라고? - 스키는 항상 같이 타잖니

translation.en: I know, but it's a bit different.
But we're supposed to make gingerbread cookies together.
Can't we make gingerbread cookies some other time?
Of course! We can move the gingerbread cookie making to Easter.
translation.ko: 그래, 생강케이크 만드는 건 부활절로 미루지 뭐

translation.en: -I need to pack the rucksack. -[Hildegunn] Take this…
translation.ko: - 배낭 싸야죠 - 그래, 네가 그거 들어

translation.en: Uh… We… The two of us can go together.
-Yeah. It's called koselig, right? -[Thea] We're home soon. I promise.
translation.ko: 그래, 이런 게 '코셀리'한 거지? 거의 다 왔어, 진짜야

translation.en: We just need to go down to Oksetjønn and take a left to Skjerdalen.
translation.ko: 옥세셴으로 내려간 다음 왼쪽 셰르달렌으로 가면 돼

translation.en: Those names mean nothing. You're making them up.
translation.ko: 지명 같은 건 아무 의미 없어 다 지어낸 거잖아

translation.en: -[sighs] -[Jashan] I won't do it. Leave me here.
Have you ever done this before?
My dad used to do it with me.
Do you want me to ask Simen to look for them?
No, let him relax. He's put on his comfy joggers…
translation.ko: 그냥 쉬게 해 벌써 편안한 추리닝 바지 입고

translation.en: with a glass of Christmas soda in his hand,
getting into the spirit with Die Hard.
[Thea] It's just difficult without my dad.
And every year is just a reminder of what we lost.
translation.ko: 그래서 해마다 아빠가 없다는 게 느껴져

translation.en: And I really want them to like you
You know, in Norway, we call this koselig.
[in English] You guys know each other?
That's crazy. What a small country.
[in Norwegian] Are you going somewhere? What are you doing here?
-[Jashan in English] Hey. -I'm just telling him that we're not lost.
translation.ko: 방금 우리 길 안 잃었다고 말했어

translation.en: We're not lost. We're just going to "Oksischen" and "Shellbraider."
You sure you don't want a ride?
-Dude, we would love a ride. -Yes. We're fine.
I'm not gonna ski back. Yes, we would love a ride.
translation.ko: 난 스키 안 타 네, 태워주세요

translation.en: -[Jørgen] Okay. -Thank you so much. That's amazing.
[gasps] Oh, dude, can I sit in the carriage? [Jørgen] Let me take the skis.
translation.ko: - 짐 싣는 데 타도 돼요? - 스키 주세요

translation.en: [in English] Oh, God bless you, Jørgen.
Dude, we're making something called "pepper cakes." You wanna come inside?
What do you mean, dude? You saved my life.
Come on. Come inside. We'll have a drink or something.
It might be a bit weird.
Why would it be weird? What? You guys used to hook up or something?
translation.ko: 왜 어색하죠? 둘이 예전에 사귀기라도 했어요?

translation.en: Didn't really… get to that part.
No, we just live together. We don't talk about stuff. [chuckles]
translation.ko: 네, 같이 살긴 하지만 얘기는 잘 안 하죠

translation.en: Oh, hey, see you around, dude.
[in English] So that's the guy from the picture in the stairway.
translation.ko: 복도에 걸린 사진에 있던 그 남자구나

translation.en: [in Norwegian] Don't you think you should get a new apron?
I've always had it. Lasse gave it to me when we were…
translation.ko: 맨날 입던 건데? 라스가 예전에 준 거란 말이야

translation.en: So you thought it was a good idea to call my ex?
translation.ko: 옛날 남친을 부르는 게 좋은 방법 같았어요?

translation.en: I was worried about you two. I got scared.
Mom, that is a very weird thing to do.
Remember that before he was your ex, he was the kid next door.
translation.ko: 너랑 사귀기 전엔 그냥 옆집 남자애였잖니

translation.en: So if you think it's weird, it's because you're making it weird.
translation.ko: 그게 이상해 보이는 건 네가 이상하게 생각해서지

translation.en: Yeah. I just can't figure out this house.
But I'm happy to be inside.
It would have been nice to get some heads-up that your ex lives next door.
translation.ko: 전 남친이 옆집에 산다는 걸 미리 알려줬으면 참 좋았겠는데

translation.en: [in Norwegian] I almost forgot. When are we doing our Christmas dip tomorrow?
translation.ko: 깜빡할 뻔했네, 내일 크리스마스 수영은 언제 할까?

translation.en: Can't we just do it when we wake up?
translation.ko: 우리 깨고 나서 하면 안 돼요?

translation.en: -[in English] Are you going to the… -Ah, you bet, Simen.
I am here for the full Norwegian Christmas experience.
translation.ko: 노르웨이의 크리스마스를 온전히 경험하려고 온 거니까요

translation.en: No, Jashan, you don't really need to do that.
translation.ko: 아냐, 자샨, 자긴 안 해도 돼

translation.en: Oh, that's nice that you're joining us for isbading.
I am very happy to join you for… what?
translation.ko: 기꺼이 동참할 생각입니다 그런데 그게, 뭐라고요?
- 건강에 좋아 - 이게 어떻게 건강에 좋아?

translation.en: You said you wanted the full Norwegian Christmas experience.
Yeah, but that was before I knew you guys were crazy.
translation.ko: 그야 미친 사람들인 걸 알기 전 얘기지
안녕 - 안 올 리가 없지 - 다들…
- 안 올 리가 없지 - 다들… - 안녕하세요 - 해야 하니까
그럼, 당연하지 - 메리 크리스마스! - 메리 크리스마스!

translation.en: Isn't it a bit too cold for him?
-Uh… -[in English] It's a bit too cold for you.
Oh, no, no. I was just actually warming up before I went in.
translation.ko: 아니에요, 들어가기 전에 잠깐 준비운동 중입니다

translation.en: -[Jørgen] You must be cold. [laughs] -[Anne-Lise] Not at all.
It's so nice that you came.
Merry Christmas. This is so nice. [chuckles]
[in English] I have to admit, I hated it when these two little birds
translation.ko: 솔직히 저도 처음엔 싫었어요 이 사랑스러운 두 여성분이 저한테

translation.en: forced me into ice bathing for the first time. [laughs]
Well, actually, you know, no one's forcing me, so…
-Oh. No, no, no. Of course. -[Jashan] Yeah. Yeah.
for the full Norwegian Christmas experience.
translation.ko: 노르웨이의 크리스마스를 온전히 경험하러 온 거라서요

translation.en: Jash, you really don't have to do it. It's fine.
[whispers in English] I didn't know you were Christian.
Why are we in a church?
And because Ronja is in the choir, and she is looking forward to her solo.
translation.ko: 그리고 로니아가 성가대거든 자기 솔로 부분 얼마나 기대했는데

translation.en: ♪ In the soul's joyful pilgrim song ♪
[Jashan singing loudly in bad accent] ♪ Angels first sang it ♪
[Jashan singing loudly in bad accent] ♪ In joy it passed ♪
[in English] Yeah, but it's too loud.

translation.ko: - 사람들이 너무 작게 부르는 거지 - 알았어

translation.en: [singing quietly in bad Norwegian accent] ♪ Peace over Earth ♪
[whispers in bad accent] ♪ A savior for all time is born ♪
Before we go out into this beautiful Christmas Day,
translation.ko: 이 아름다운 성탄절에 교회를 나서기 전에

translation.en: wish you a Merry Christmas with this--
[in Norwegian] With this delightful Christmas classic.
You're the one who said ice bathing was a good idea.
translation.ko: 얼음물 입수가 좋다고 한 사람이 자기였잖아

translation.en: -[Jashan sneezes, sniffles] -♪ Round yon Virgin Mother and Child ♪
♪ Holy infant so tender and mild ♪
Fine. I'll go out in the cold.
[Jashan] I'm sure freezing temperature will help.
translation.ko: 그래, 꽁꽁 어는 것도 나쁘지 않지

translation.en: Can you hear me? Hello. Hi.
They just come to church for Christmas.
They do weird things, and when I ask why, it's just tradition.
translation.ko: 자꾸 이상한 걸 하는데 이유를 물으면 그냥 전통이래요

translation.en: [in Norwegian] Thea, can you please stop your boyfriend?
translation.ko: 테아, 가서 네 남친 좀 말릴래?

translation.en: [Jashan in Hindi] They do weird things all the time.
translation.ko: 자꾸 이상한 걸 하는데 왜냐고 이유를 물으면

translation.en: If you ask why, "That's just how it is…"
[whispering in English] How do you say, "I'm sorry, Ronja"?
I'm not talking about the church.
I thought it'd be fun to bring my loudest kurta to a Christmas party but…
translation.ko: 크리스마스 파티 때 제일 화려한 쿠르타를 입으면 재밌겠다 싶었는데

translation.en: -Uh, can you help me with this? -[Jashan] Sure.
-Okay. So you just want it to kind of go… -[Jashan sniffles]
Sorry. I just… It's… Yeah, just try again.
Like I needed more proof I didn't fit in here. [sniffles]
translation.ko: 내가 여기 안 어울린다는 증거가 필요했던 것처럼?

translation.en: It's like, you can't really wear jewelry
Something called bunad police. It's like a traditional thing.
You know what? I'll just go and ask my mom.
Jashan is sorry for ruining your moment in church.
translation.ko: 교회에서 네 노래 망친 거 자샨이 많이 미안해해

translation.en: There's not much left for him to ruin now.
translation.ko: 이제 망칠 것도 별로 안 남았는걸요

translation.en: We've been through all the crazy stuff leading up to Christmas.
translation.ko: 우리 그동안 크리스마스를 앞두고 별별 일을 다 겪었잖아

translation.en: Hot dog on the grill, um, church, not to mention Christmas bathing.
translation.ko: 구운 핫도그랑 교회랑 크리스마스 수영도 있지

translation.en: Don't call it Christmas bathing. It makes it sound fun.
translation.ko: 크리스마스 수영이라고 하지 마 재밌어 보이잖아

translation.en: We eat some cookies. We, uh, open presents.
And by the end of the night,
I think we should tell them. We should break the news about our engagement.
translation.ko: 가족들한테 얘기하자 우리 약혼했다는 거 알리는 거야

translation.en: -All right. Yeah. We're telling them. -[Thea] Okay.
-[Anne-Lise in Norwegian] Do you like it? -Great crispy pork crackling, Mom.
Oh no. Maybe you… you can't eat pig.
Uh, I'm Hindu. Muslims don't eat pork.
translation.ko: 저는 힌두교도라서요 무슬림이 돼지고기를 못 먹죠

translation.en: -[in Norwegian] Yes, of course. -Yes. I remember now.
[in Norwegian] Ronja, you have to eat your food, not just move it around.
translation.ko: 로니아, 음식을 먹어야지 옆에 치워두면 어떡해

translation.en: Grandma has spent so much time making it. You have to taste it. [chuckles]
Sauce. Yes. What sauce is this?
-You have to have it. -It's very good.
[Simen in Norwegian] Otherwise, it'll be too dry.
And what kind of fat is this?
Oh, no, no. It's not fat.
You know, it's the potato booze I was telling you about?
-This does help. -[Thea] Mm-hmm. -Can I have some more? -[Thea] Yeah.
translation.ko: - 진짜 도움 되네, 더 마셔도 돼? - 그럼!

translation.en: Yeah. But you don't need to do the whole shot.
I don't think that's so smart, but…
translation.ko: 그리 좋은 생각은 아닌 것 같은데…

translation.en: -Uh, do you want… -No. No. I'm not drinking.
[whispers] How am I supposed to finish this?
[in Hindi] Now this is more like it!
[in English] I'm so glad you liked it.
[Jashan] Hindu is a Norwegian spice brand?
…as an Indian person, I never thought I would be offended by spices.
translation.ko: 인도인으로서 향신료 때문에 기분 상할 줄은 꿈에도 몰랐네요

translation.en: [in Norwegian] Has he been seasoning my pork with garlic powder and piri-piri?
translation.ko: 내 돼지고기에 마늘 가루랑 고추소스를 뿌려 먹은 거니?

translation.en: No disrespect, but I use an entire garlic to fry an egg.
translation.ko: 뭘 그러세요, 무시하는 게 아니라 전 달걀프라이에도 마늘을 통째 넣어 먹어요

translation.en: …unseasoned pork with crunchy fat and chewy fat and fat sauce.
translation.ko: 간도 안 한 돼지고기에 딱딱한 비계, 질긴 비계, 비계소스까지

translation.en: Why do you have Black Boy and Hindu spices in your house?
translation.ko: 이 집에 왜 '블랙 보이'와 '힌두' 향신료가 있는 거죠?

translation.en: Well, if he doesn't like it, then I'm sure we have a lot of curries that Shazam--
translation.ko: 그렇게 싫다면야 커리 많으니까 갖다주렴, 샤잠이 만든…

translation.en: Okay? Not Shazam. Not Sasham. It's Jashan.
[in Norwegian] I'll go and get some more sausages.
[whispering in English] Can you please just try to fit in?
translation.ko: 그냥 좀 어울려 주면 안 돼?

translation.en: [softly] Like Hildegunn who pretends like she has no personality
translation.ko: - 힐데군처럼 - 힐데군처럼? 이 크리스마스 광신도 집안에 어울리려고 몰개성인 척하라고?

translation.en: so she can fit into your Norwegian Christmas cult.
translation.ko: 이 크리스마스 광신도 집안에 어울리려고 몰개성인 척하라고?

translation.en: Yeah. Christmas cult, with your crazy uniforms and your weird rituals.
translation.ko: 그래, 똑같은 스웨터 입고 괴상한 의식 치르는 광신도 집안

translation.en: I'm not asking you to dye your hair blond or to speak Norwegian.
translation.ko: 머리카락을 금발로 염색하라거나 노르웨이어 하라는 것도 아니잖아

translation.en: -[doorbell rings] -I just want my family to be happy for us.
translation.ko: 난 그저 우리 가족이 우릴 인정해 주길 바랐어

translation.en: Why would they be happy for us if you force me to eat pork fat?
translation.ko: 어떻게 인정해? 자기가 나한테 억지로 돼지비계를 먹이는데

translation.en: So is baby tossing and human sacrifice and stoning.
Just because it's tradition doesn't mean it's good.
translation.ko: 전통이라고 해서 무조건 다 좋은 건 아니지

translation.en: [in English] Can we please talk about this later? No, I am upset now.
translation.ko: - 이 얘긴 나중에 할까? - 아니, 난 지금 화났어

translation.en: And is that the answer for everything?
Why do atheists go to church? It's Christmas.
Why do we swim in ice water? It's Christmas.
Why do we hide our feelings? It's Christmas.
[Anne-Lise in Norwegian] Thea, Santa is here!
What does it say on this one?
-[in Norwegian] Come on, Aunt Thea. -You must come and get your present.
translation.ko: - 빨리 와요, 테아 고모 - 빨리 와서 선물 받아 가렴

translation.en: Maybe you want to sit on Santa's lap?
translation.ko: 너도 산타 할아버지 무릎에 앉고 싶니?

translation.en: -You have to sit. -Yes, you have to sit.
[Jørgen] There we go. This is cozy.
Have you been a good girl this year, Aunt Thea?
[in English] I'm sorry. Am I the only one who finds this weird?
translation.ko: 잠깐만요 이거 지금 나만 이상한 거예요?

translation.en: [in Norwegian] Maybe someone is upset he's not getting a present from Santa this year?
translation.ko: 올해 산타한테 선물을 못 받아서 화난 사람이 있나 보구나?

translation.en: [in Norwegian] Well, it's getting late, little Ronja.
and the night is still young.
-[in English] Yeah. -What the fuck, man? Don't push me.

translation.ko: - 그래? 한 번 더 말해 봐 - 자샨

translation.en: I think Santa should get going. [sighs]
Because you don't fit in to this Christmas cult?
translation.ko: 이 크리스마스 광신도 집안에 못 어울려서?

translation.en: -[in Norwegian] Let's bring the candy to… -[Jashan sighs]
-[Simen] I'm gonna chop some wood. -[Anne-Lise] I'll start the dishes.
translation.ko: - 난 장작 패러 가야겠어 - 난 설거지 시작할게

translation.en: [in English] Do you think that's what it's about?
I knew it would be difficult to fit in with your family,
translation.ko: 자기 집안에 어울리기가 어렵다는 건 알고 있었어

translation.en: and I knew it would be difficult to fit in with your traditions.
translation.ko: 자기 집안 전통에 어울리기 어렵다는 것도

translation.en: And if you came to India, you would have a hard time fitting in too.
The difference is, I would have had your back. [exhales]
translation.ko: 하지만 나라면 자기 편이 돼줬을 거야

translation.en: Or are you someone so obsessed with making Christmas perfect that you lost sight of me?
translation.ko: 크리스마스에 너무 집착해서 난 보이지도 않았잖아?

translation.en: Then why won't you tell your family we're engaged?
translation.ko: 그럼 왜 가족한테 우리 약혼한 거 말 안 해?

translation.en: I was just waiting for the right moment.
-So, listen to some music, or do you… -[Jashan] I'm okay.
[driver] Yes. But we can be silent. That's all. No problem.
translation.ko: 네, 조용히 있죠 뭐 아무 문제 없어요

translation.en: [Thea in Norwegian] Look at the nice colors.
No. You can't be sad on Christmas Eve.
There are many presents left, Ronja. Why don't you go get one more?
translation.ko: 로니아, 선물이 많이 남았는데 가서 하나 더 가져올래?

translation.en: [voice breaks] He is actually really cool.
It was just Jørgen who was pretending because he is in love with you.
translation.ko: 샤잠이 고모를 사랑하니까 예르겐이 산타인 척한 거죠

translation.en: I don't think he's actually in love. [sniffles]
But Jashan ruined your song in church, and you were so excited about it.
translation.ko: 너 교회에서 노래할 때 자샨이 다 망쳐버렸잖니 네가 얼마나 기대했는데

translation.en: Not really. I just sang because Mom says that Grandma wants me to.
I like it when the children sing.
translation.ko: 아이들 노래할 때 참 듣기 좋더라

translation.en: I was thinking. Your bunad is so beautiful.
translation.ko: 그나저나 오늘 입으신 부나드 참 아름다워요

translation.en: -I don't give a shit. -You can't say "shit."
translation.ko: - 이브는 개뿔 - '개뿔'이란 말 쓰면 안 되죠

translation.en: No, I'm not sure, Mom. I'm not.
I just can't listen to you right now.
And I know you think that my relationship with Jashan is just a phase
translation.ko: 엄마는 자샨이랑 내가 잠시 스쳐 지나갈 사이인 줄 알죠

translation.en: because I've messed around so much.
[whispers] Maybe you should go and play with your Christmas gifts.
translation.ko: 넌 가서 크리스마스 선물 갖고 놀아

translation.en: I've just tried to make everything right this Christmas
translation.ko: 이번 크리스마스엔 모든 걸 제대로 하려고 노력했어요

translation.en: because I know it's important to you and because
I wanted to do it like we always did it with Dad
translation.ko: 항상 아빠랑 하던 대로 하고 싶었으니까요

translation.en: to help Jashan fit in and… [sobs]
And to make you like him.
But it's not mine or Jashan's job to make you like him.
translation.ko: 하지만 엄마가 자샨을 좋아하게 만드는 건 내 몫도, 자샨의 몫도 아니에요

translation.en: [sniffles] This was supposed to be happy news,
but I might as well say it now since everyone is in such great spirits.
translation.ko: 지금 분위기가 짱이니까 그냥 말하는 게 낫겠네요

translation.en: Pretty stupid to throw him out on Christmas Eve, then.
I thought my life was perfect.
You were supposed to live in the house next door,
translation.ko: 넌 계속 우리 옆집에 살 테고

translation.en: and your kids were supposed to come to our house to do homework
translation.ko: 네 아이들은 우리 집에 와서 숙제하고

translation.en: I'm the one who should say sorry.
I'm just afraid to lose you.
There is a reason you don't drink alcohol on Christmas Eve.
translation.ko: 크리스마스이브에 술을 안 마시는 데는 이유가 있어

translation.en: You didn't all have to come with me.
Of course we had to come. We all have to apologize.
translation.ko: 당연히 가야죠 우리 모두 사과해야 하니까

translation.en: Can we please slow down a bit?
We are on our way to the airport on Christmas Eve.
translation.ko: 시멘, 우린 지금 크리스마스이브에 공항에 가는 거야

translation.en: We're getting her fiancé. This is the most romantic thing I've ever experienced.
translation.ko: 테아 약혼자 데리러 내 평생 가장 로맨틱한 일이니까 제발 좀 닥쳐 줘

translation.en: -Shut up, please. -Saying shut up is not allowed.
translation.ko: 내 평생 가장 로맨틱한 일이니까 제발 좀 닥쳐 줘 닥치라는 말은 쓰면 안 되죠

translation.en: Your mom is allowed to say shut up.
translation.ko: 아냐, 네 엄마는 닥치라는 말 써도 돼

translation.en: We're not going to make it.
Of course we're going to make it.
And you were totally right about everything you said
about me not having your back.
I'm sorry I didn't tell them about the engagement.
translation.ko: 가족들한테 약혼 얘기 안 한 거 미안해

translation.en: I just… I don't know. I thought it would be easier that way.
translation.ko: 잘 모르겠지만 그냥 그게 더 쉽다고 생각했어

translation.en: How… How did you get inside the airport?
[Anne-Lise] Do you think Santa will come tonight?
[Jashan] I don't think Santa's gonna come after last year.
translation.ko: 작년 일 때문에 안 오실 거 같은데요

translation.en: [in English] Oh, I wonder what it is. Yeah.
You know what, Jashan, I, uh…
I just have to say I loved the tikka ma-pinnekjøtt.
translation.ko: 자샨, 내가 인정할게요 티카마살라 피네셰트 끝내줬어요

translation.en: Thank you very much, man, but it was all her idea.
translation.ko: 정말 고마워요 근데 그거 어머니 아이디어예요

translation.en: [in Norwegian] Thank you so much, Anne-Lise.
THE REAL "JASHAN" & "THEA" ♪ Come on and do the bhangra everybody ♪ ♪ Hey, hey, hey, hey, hey ♪
If you like this, you're going to love the wedding in India.
translation.ko: 이게 맘에 드시면 인도 결혼식도 정말 좋아하실걸요

translation.en: I was going to tell you.
